title: Army Men dingbat?
content:
Hey folks,   
I came across a dingbat font of army men (like the childhood toy) a couple years ago, but now I can't find it or even remember the name. Is anyone familiar with this? It kinda had the same feel as Swifty. Any help would be appreciated.   
   
Cheers!
author: swalsh

comments.content:
Sarah,   
 Since nobody has found your font, I'll mention this [WW2 Soldier Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109094437/http:/www.mapsymbs.com/fontstuf.html).   
   
It's not really like those old plastic figures (these are mostly in at-ease,   
relaxed poses), but it's all I could find.
I have seen the dingbats you are looking for. I'll have to see where I got them. I'll let you know what I find.
thanks for the effort, but it's not Army Boy. It's a dingbat font where each letter shows a toy soldier in a different pose. there are no actual aphanumeric characters in the font.
